hero.question: US strikes Iran by March 7, 2026?
hero.prob_take: Traders are pulling back hard on Iran strikes, with odds falling 8.5 points to 28.5% as diplomatic channels stay open and military escalation remains off the immediate menu. Watch the next round of nuclear negotiations and any rhetoric from the White House, since either could instantly shift this from a 1-in-4 shot to something nobody's betting on.

daily_take.headline: War Traders Just Priced Out an Iran Strike. Here's Why They're Wrong.
daily_take.deck: The odds on a US strike against Iran dropped 8.5 points overnight to 28.5%, suggesting traders are betting on cooler heads prevailing in the next 13 months. But the Middle East doesn't reward complacency. A single regional escalation, Israeli retaliation, or Pentagon miscalculation flips this entire calculation.
